title: Optimal Transport and Information Geometry
description: Understanding optimal transport theory and its connections to information geometry and Active Inference.
learning_objectives: Understand optimal transport and Wasserstein distance
Connect optimal transport to information geometry
Apply optimal transport in Active Inference
Understand gradient flows in probability space

content.overview: Optimal transport theory studies how to move mass from one distribution to another in the most efficient way. It provides geometric tools for comparing probability distributions and understanding gradient flows in probability space.

optimal_transport_fundamentals.transport_problem: Minimize ∫ c(x,y) dπ(x,y) over joint distributions π with marginals μ, ν
optimal_transport_fundamentals.transport_plan: π(x,y) represents how much mass moves from x to y
optimal_transport_fundamentals.cost_function: c(x,y) measures cost of moving from x to y
optimal_transport_fundamentals.optimal_transport: π* that minimizes total transport cost

wasserstein_distance.interpretation: Minimum cost to transform μ into ν
wasserstein_distance.properties: Metric on probability space, geodesic distance
wasserstein_distance.convergence: Weak convergence plus W_1 convergence implies strong convergence

benamou_brenier_formula.gradient_flow: Optimal transport as gradient flow of energy

connections_to_information_geometry.gradient_flows: Natural gradient flow vs Wasserstein gradient flow

applications_in_active_inference.policy_optimization: Optimal policies as transport between distributions

examples.name: Gaussian Transport
examples.solution: W_2(μ₁, μ₂) = ∥μ₁ - μ₂∥ for equal variance

examples.name: Heat Equation
examples.interpretation: Gradient flow of entropy with respect to Wasserstein metric

numerical_methods.linear_programming: Solve discrete optimal transport as LP
numerical_methods.gradient_flows: Simulate gradient flows in probability space
numerical_methods.sampling_methods: Monte Carlo methods for continuous transport

interactive_exercises.description: Compute optimal transport between simple distributions
Simulate gradient flows in probability space

common_misconceptions.misconception: Optimal transport is only about physical transport
common_misconceptions.clarification: Also applies to abstract spaces and probability distributions
Different metrics measuring different types of distance
Efficient algorithms exist for many cases
